intro: Chaetanthera linearis, commonly known as the slender chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
